meanings.definition: Substances that prevent the development of cancer.
meanings.sent1: Eating foods rich in anticarcinogens can help protect against cancer.
meanings.sent2: Doctors recommend including anticarcinogens in your diet to lower the risk of cancer.
meanings.sent3: The anticarcinogens in fruits and vegetables are like little superheroes fighting off cancer.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acts as an anticarcinogen, warding off any negativity that could lead to cancer.
meanings.sent5: Imagine anticarcinogens as tiny shields that defend your body from cancer invaders.

meanings.definition: Agents that inhibit the growth of cancer cells.
meanings.sent1: Certain medications contain anticarcinogens to stop cancer cells from spreading.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying new anticarcinogens to find better treatments for cancer.
meanings.sent3: The anticarcinogens in the medicine work like traffic cops, blocking the growth of cancer cells.
meanings.sent4: Her determination acts as an anticarcinogen, halting the progress of any cancerous thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The anticarcinogens are like gardeners pruning away the cancer cells to keep the body healthy.

meanings.definition: Compounds that have the ability to reduce the risk of cancer.
meanings.sent1: Including anticarcinogens in your daily routine can lower your chances of developing cancer.
meanings.sent2: Health experts emphasize the importance of consuming anticarcinogens for cancer prevention.
meanings.sent3: The anticarcinogens in tea dance around, keeping cancer risks at bay.
meanings.sent4: Her love for life acts as an anticarcinogen, diminishing any looming cancer threats.
meanings.sent5: Think of anticarcinogens as bodyguards shielding you from the dangers of cancer.
